text: Great service and even better food. Just received the greatest service by the gentlemen and the lady at the line. He addressed me by my first name (my name tag helped) and the young lady offered me  fresh meat coming from the back. Awesome!!!! :-)

Dear Chipotle, when I order a burrito and chips I expect a burrito and chips - that's it. Nothing more nothing less. I don't want a burrito and chips WITH HAIR!!! 

Full Story: I placed my order online because  the line can get long at this location during lunch. I picked if up at the scheduled time and went back to work to eat it. Little did I know of the surprises that lay ahead... I'll leave it up to you, the reader, to reconstruct what happened. Protip: read the first paragraph.

I'm never going to eat here again. I start to gag just thinking about it.

As I mentioned in my last review of a different chipotle one of the things I like most about this establishment is the consistent great flavors you experience at every site you eat at.  This location tends to be extra busy and seating can be an issue if you are planning on dining in.  The lunch rush is a killer.

I go to this location for lunch 2-3 times a week. The staff is very friendly and the food is always tasty and  fresh. Richard the manager has my order memorized. Maurice super nice guy always up beat and  remembers my condiments. Nice place to get a great meal.

It's really unfortunate that I'm giving this chipotle a bad review, because I absolutely love everything chipotle, but I've been in this chipotle twice now and both times have been a horrible experience. 

Twice now I've done the online ordering from this location (it's closest to my place) and every time I go in their to pick it up, and I'm usually 15 minutes late, they never have my order ready and act totally surprised when I get there. So I have to stand their and wait while they frantically make my order and receive death stares from the other guests waiting in line. Pretty aggravating.

I gave it 2 stars because my heart couldn't come to leave 1 star for a chipotle, since it's still an amazing restaurant (just not this location)

I place large orders from this location for my office frequently. The website is easy to use and the local staff is helpful answering questions about special orders. They're almost always punctual and accurate.
We went an hour before close and still got great food and service. Even got samples of the chorizo. My salad was delicious and I got free tortillas with it. Great option for a quick dinner.
Terrible customer service skills and they skimp out on everything. My burrito bowl was half the size it normally is. I guess I should have stayed in Green Valley.

The service is super fast but I've come here on multiple occasions and their service portion is always less than half of all other chipotles super disappointing. This is the closest to my house and I will now be driving out of my way to get a decent sized order of the 8 dollar bowl I want instead of having to pay extra when I want a suitable amount.

I went to eat yesterday Wednesday april 5 around 4pm and my wife order a steak burrito the steak taste old and maybe spoiled i talk to the supervisor at the time i told them about the steak tasted bad.a few hours past and my wife started to complain about her stomach hurting and feeling like vomiting

I must be out of the loop, but I just came across this fast food joint and have to say I love it.

Its nice to get great mexican food without the wait.  I can walk in at pretty much anytime and get my food in less than ten minutes.

The food and price are great.

Its good place for quick food, the staffs always nice and the place always clean.
They are super busy always but they have great food.
 I recommend  order online first. I hope they can delivery.

The service here is absolutely horrible, every time I place an online order it is not ready and I have to wait an additional 15 to 20 minutes. They care less about their customers and you're even lucky if you can get somebody that speaks proper English there I recommend other chipotles in town but not this one

They are very stingy with the amount of food they place in the bowls. After all the ingredients my bowl is still not full. And the employees gave me a questioning look when I asked for extra lettuce. Really? You want to stiff me on lettuce? Never again at this location. I've been to other Chipotle locations around the valley who have given me ample portions in the bowls.
The food is always fresh, and no matter how long the line is, you will be through in just a few minutes thanks to the assembly line process to make your food in a custom fashion.

One of the best fast food places around.
Aside from the good food they offer, I was very nicely surprised that they offer beer at this location. Thumbs up for that. Being from overseas I appreciate things like that, grabbing a beer with your lunch.
The food was very good I had a steak salad with pretty much all the stuff you can get in it, corn, beans, salsa etc. I was very hungry so the portion felt small but the Corona made it up for that.
I like the place and the food too.
The staff were kind of annoyed by all the customers and the routine of the job so they get 2 stars out of 5, other than that good experience :)

This branch is really REALLY stingy on the guac. For an extra fee I expect at least a spoonful but you see them expending effort to create as little a dollop as possible. 

For that matter even the other toppings were on the measly side.

Also, where are the knives in the condiments area? Had to walk back to the cointer to ask for a few. Ended up with grimy knife handles from the staff  we  Interrupted mid-burrito. Is this SOP??

c'mon chipotle! It's not as if your reputation is the best right now. Try harder winning us back!
Burritos the size of a small child's head. About $10 a meal gets you obscene amounts of chow. Consistent service and food.
This chipotle is usually pretty quick but if u happen to come between 12pm-2pm u will have to b in line for about 15-20mins

Busy location. Good fresh food, carnitas bowl is my fav. They did serve it with plastic mixed in with my lettuce before, they manager gave me a credit for free bowl. Only other downside is last year Chipotle everywhere started giving you smaller portions, which is annoying. When asked they said it's to done to be a certain amount of calories, but its totally arbitrary- they give different depending on the server. One server gave me half the food as they normally do and I asked for more, which they complied.
The food is pretty good, but I really liked how an employee who was in the register worked. He had everything cleaned and didnt stop. Customer service was okaay.

I ordered double meat chicken and barbacoa and these guys are stingy, my bowl looked like it was half and half instead of double. Probably the worst chipotle I've been to when it comes to giving me the right amount of food. Will go somewhere else. This place is a tourist spot and they don't care if the customer comes back or not.
Standard issue Chipotle. The store is clean and the service was good.  The only reason I didn't go the full 5 stars is because the portions seemed a bit smaller than other Chipotle's I've ate at.

Steak/Barbacoa is my favorite!

From Los Angeles and this is the first chipotle that sells alcohol. I love Vegas!

Only thing is that I asked for more Barbacoa meat and they gave me a strip. 

Conveniently located in next to the Las Vegas Premium outlets.

Yes, I must say, this is not one of my favorite chipotles. I have been here dozens of times and they're just about average, in my opinion. They have never been particularly quick and I have had margaritas made here a couple times that were all off recipe. The patio at this location is nice, However, because it is mostly shaded.

My wife got sick after eating lunch she threw up three times after lunch there ....Horrible customer service from the Mexican lady that seemed to be in charge there... extremely rude and obnoxious lady with no manners , she was    working on the cashier but she really belongs in the back where she cannot communicate with customers. There were other ladies there that were also Mexican and they were great working the line they were excellent in their service and had a very great attitude , The other lady on the cashier was repulsive .

Very disappointed. I ordered online with a pick up time at 11:45 am and sat there over 20 minutes while the whole line before me was served and the place cleared out and my order was still not done. What's the point of ordering ahead of time if I'm waiting over twenty minutes past pick up time? And it was cold. Never again. And I pod extra for steak and it had no meat on it, seriously?!

Whenever I'm in the mood for a delicious big burrito, this is where I go. This location of Chipotle is on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Warm Springs Rd so it's relatively easy to get into and out of, which I like. I feel like it doesn't matter what time I arrive at Chipotle, there's always a long line, but for the most part, the line moves quickly. I once ordered online to pick up at this location, but I still had to wait to jump in and pay for my meal. In fact, when I online ordered, they hadn't even made it yet so they made my burrito quickly.

The food is yummy, like most Chipotles, and the price is reasonable for the amount of food that you get in return. I always take my burrito to go, but glancing at the rest of the restaurant and I see that it is usually clean though filled with people eating. The downside to this location is that it opens at 11 am (boo!) and there is always a line. But hey, it's totally worth it for a Chipotle burrito so I don't mind.

The food is good here and the staff is friendly. I had a free burrito or taco plate coupon so I figured I'd stop in and use it. I ordered online and went to pick up my order. The lady apologized and said it didn't come through properly. They quickly made my order and apologized again. It was pretty busy and there was a long line so I can see how it happened.

My tacos were stuffed and overflowing. They definitely didn't skimp on the meat either and I ended up taking half my order home. Next time I'll probably skip the online ordering and just go in person.
This Chipotle made me a monster burrito today.  And it tasted great.  Will eat here again, especially now that Chipotle started a reward program!

Great burritos and they serve beer!!

However compared to the one by UNLV (Maryland and Harmon) its not as good. They hook it up with Guacamole over there, big portions and if you show your student ID you get a free drink. Bad ass. 

Still this place is great if you dont want Mall food or other crap near by. 
Oh and the price is not marked up at all even though its on the strip.
Please buy a legit ice t machine. Last 4 times I've been here there was no tea and I literally threw my drink in trash since I can't drink your other sugar rich options. Waste of money. Thanks

I like Chipotle, but it's just not anything great, a very average place.  The good points are that the burrito's and burrito bowls are pretty good sized although half of it is usually rice.  The meats taste pretty good, the salsa is good and the prices are cheap.  I also think the place is usually pretty clean and the staff has been nice.  The negatives are simple, not enough main dish selections.  Pretty much a burrito, bowl, or tacos is about it.  Would be nice if they had other selections, like quesadillas, nachos etc.  I also don't understand why the staff has to pass you from one person to another like 4-5 times during the course of one order.  I have seen this situation cause some confusion with people's orders.  Why can't one person just follow me through the whole process and than maybe pass me to the register person?  Chips would be good here if they didn't have so much salt.  I like salt, but most of the time the chips I got are WAY over salted to where the chips actually have a sour vinegar like taste.  I find myself scraping salt off the chips every time.

Busiest location I think; there burrito's are so delicious and worth it. So huge you can cut it in half and save it for lunch tomorrow or share with a friend. Pricey but good.  Love the taste of the corn and guacomole everything is made fresh and also there chips to. Chicken is kinda spicy haven't tried the other meats but sure they are delicious as well.

The service was great! The Manager,  Adriana Campos was most welcoming to us and Maurice , who was the cashier, was so very nice and polite.  They wereso nice here and the food was so good.  The ambiance is casual as this is a fast food type of Mexican Restaurant.  I would recommend this place

So today i stopped again, my only issue is once again she shorted me on my change.... This is twice in both times i paid with cash that change was short... :( Re do...,drink is small now that ive been to other locations. These guys rock.... Fast perfect every time!!!!!

Gave this joint a second chance on the Beef Burrito as the last one was stuffed with gristly/fatty steak that you could chew for days.  Not a fan.  To pay $1.00 more for steak, I'll pass and stick with the chicken.  

Next...

First time at a Chipotle. Line was crazy long! I almost turned around but decided to tough it out. The system moves people through quickly,  and the wait is definitely worth the wait. 

Got myself a barbacoa burrito. The thing was as big big as my forearm. 

Two of these bad boys and two beer for $22! What the!!!? Smoking deal! 

Check it out fo' sho'!

I had the worst service I have ever had today at this location. I came back to this chipotle because I was promised a free bowl because of the carelessness of the one I had 2 days prior. When I came in I spoke with Adriana P (I believe that's her last initial) and when I was speaking to her about my order she was looking at me as if I was lying (squinting her eyes and turning her head sideways) so when they finished making my bowl I asked for her last initial (because they told me there were 2 Adriana's) she asked why (very unprofessional) I told her I was going to make a complaint then she rolled her eyes and snatched the receipt that I had in my hand. Also the young Caucasian cashier standing next to her was looking at me and rolling her eyes. I come to this location at least once a week. But I will take my money to the location on blue diamond from now on. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!
Have only been to this restaurant a handful of times, but the service is always fast, food is always fresh, and dining area is always clean.

We spent 40mins online using the order form going thru one by one each persons order because no one in store is apparently capable of taking an order.

After all that, we pick up the food.

So let me make sure everyone understands this. We spent 40 mins filling out an order form to ensure everyones order is correct.  Not one order out of 14 is correct. 

These people who work here simply do not care for you, your food or service.

Thank you guys for ruining our lunch and making my crew extremely pissed off.
Very consistent. Not the best quality sometimes but what do you expect when sitting in warmers.  Customer service is decent as well.

You figured that because I'm a regular here I'd love the place but not so.  I enjoy them to a point and dislike them to a point. Well the good are that they're convenient located between a Chevron and Outback Steakhouse in a large shopping center near the strip, they're fast at least at night when there hasn't been a lot of people during lunch it get busier but they manage, they're friendly they sometimes crack jokes, and they're huge in size. Sometimes, well most times, their burritos are so big that they struggle to close it up which are both good and bad because it spills out while you eat even with the foil wrapped around but it's fills you.  They're huge that after I eat the whole thing I ask myself why did I do that.  More of the bad are that the fillings are cold not warm or hot but cold.  It just kills the burrito for me when I'm eating it and bite after bite I get a cold piece of something here and there.  There is a solution for this though order the bowl and ask for additional tortillas.  You can heat up the ingredients in the bowl and wrap your burrito to manageable sizes.

I enjoy the layout lots of interior seatings and lots of exterior seatings in its outside covered patio area.

Our Burritos are Huge, Our Parking Lot is Small says the sign outside of Chipotle. Today's visit to Chipotle was the opposite. Perhaps the serving spoons have shrunk in size or the staff has been instructed to go light on the ingredients. I had to ask for more rice, more beans, pretty much more of everything. I didn't take the chance of asking for more meat because I know there would be an upcharge. Even after salsa, cheese and lettuce, I was left with a burrito bowl fit for the size of a small toddler. Many of the other burritos I saw go though the line seemed under stuffed as well. The chips were chewy in a bag that was 10% filled and the guacamole tasted like lemons (which means it's old). Cafe Rio costs a couple more dollars, uses better ingredients, doesn't stick you with half a meal and has a rewards program. On a final note, seriously do something about the overly obnoxious music in there.

This place is amazing!  Love the food.  I am a regular, like 2 to 3 times every week.  Great value @ $8 for a filled up steak bowl.  Employees are very friendly.  The night shift people are really quick.  Shout out to Maurice and Richard; they are always so enthusiastic and greet the customers.

Let me just say, Carnitas. It doesn't matter if it's a burrito or a bowl. If it's carnitas, it's good. Black  or pinto beans. Both are delicious. The rice is perfectly laced with lime.

Second best  is barbacoa.
Just wanna stop by and say how AMAZING our service everytime we come into the store. Karla, Maurice & Odet always go above & beyond to make us happy! Props to them!

So this was my first time ever trying out Chipotle. My friends and I were coming back from Town Square and wanted to grab something quick to eat. It's kind of like Subway, where you choose your own ingredients. I got a burrito with white rice, chicken, and salsa. With this being my first time, it was worth it and I want to try it again.

You know that random Chipotle craving you get sometimes? Well I was having one of those at work and decided to stop at this location since it was on my way home. It's a pretty big location in the plaza of Premium Outlets South, so it's easy to spot. 

Ok, so I walk in and it's not too busy, like 3 people ahead of me. So the guy in front of me orders a bowl with no beans. So the employee gives him 2 scoops of rice instead without the customer asking for it. So when I go to order my steak bowl with no beans, the employee only gives me one scoop. Wtf? I just saw you pouring 2 scoops for the dude before me. Is it because I'm a small person? Anyway, I asked for more rice. He put the steak on and it was time for the veggie part. So off I move along the line to the female employee putting the salsa. I ask for salsa, corn, lettuce and a small amount of sour cream since I know they always put a huge dollop of it. When I go to pay, I ask the cashier for a side of guacamole and a side of sour cream as well. When the cashier asked the female employee for my sides, she looked at me and went "ugh." Jeez, I'm sorry I want sour cream on the side instead of all over my food. It's not like it's coming out of your check. Give me my damn sour cream and shut up and do your job. 

I love Chipotle and the food is always delicious. I think next time I'll drive to the one in Anthem instead.

Got the chicken bowl and it was delicious! Extra lettuce and corn makes it feel healthier! Try to avoid during busy hours though.

The setting and location are very nice.

tldr

Came around 12:30 and just beat the lunch rush with a line out the door!
Pretty regular chipotle, looking the same as the others, nice and clean.

Get:
-my usual: burrito with chicken, rice, lettuce, tomatoes, tomatillo sauce, corn, black beans on the side
-guacamole on the side!

Protip: guac is extra brah
Love the non GMO!!! They have great healthy options and are environmentally friendly :) what more can you ask for!!!

Chipotle is a classic Vegas staple.... All the restaurants are clean, spacious, and well organized.  The assembly line where the employee puts your food together couldn't be simpler for the customer or the employee.  

Fresh meat and veggies
Clean, roomy location
Fast and friendly staff
Overall A+

The smallest portion you receive in town. Never come here again. The size of my $7.50 steak bowl was ridiculously tiny. I can count how many steak pieces I received. It was a rip off. This place is a joke. My husband ask for a bowl as well, all he asked is to put a little bit more meat, so Chipotle charged him $3.15 EXTRA for steak...its a shame to see a company this big be this frugal

It is really hard to mess up Chipotle's quality and service and this place does not disappoint.  The same quality food you get from any other Chipotle and the same great service.  This location could get a little crowded due to it being on the Strip and within the outlet mall but they move the line as fast as possible.
I had a salad with a little bit of everything, except meat.. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Staff was very nice, some of the best I've ever had at a fast food place. The food was as good as any other Chipotle, but as a plus. they had red peppers when I ate there! Lots of seating available too (indoor and outdoor). One of the better Chipotles I've been to!

I came to this Chipotle prepared for regular Chipotle fare (which is already pretty awesome), but instead it was even better!

Ambiance: This is one of the newer/cleaner locations I have been to, and it is also sufficiently spacy. Well done, Chipotle.

Service: Although there was a line the workers did not rush, nor did they skimp me on the ingredients.  I've been to many Chipotles where they hastily scoop small amounts of each topping to push you down the line. Not here! I got great service with generous scoops.

Food: Just as good as always and better, RED FAJITA PEPPERS (they were in season) !  I'm not sure if it's a southern US kind of thing as they still only serve green peppers at my Nor Cal locations but awww yisssss mothaF'in  red pepper.  Added whole new dimension to my burrito bowl.

Overall, very pleasantly surprised with this location and wish I could come back more often.

My wife had never been to one of these before and since we were starved after our flight to LV we stopped in there for lunch. I like that you can choose what you want on your meal and build it up as you go. All the ingredients seemed fresh and the resulting burrito was huge, quite a meal! We liked the way you can build things as you want that we ended up going to one at BWI airport as we were waiting for a connecting flight.

The cash register girl opening chipotle on 12-20 is a rude bitch who Dosent smile and is rude the guests in front of me and me . Horrible costumer service . She won't even look at u the n the face when she talks to u. She she should be working at mc Donald's with that attitude .
I love Chipotle with all my heart! This location is awful, terrible service and I will NEVER return!!

The employees are great but I swear, it's like they make commission on the beans, rice and meat they skimp out on. Would it kill you to actually give me a decent portion size?! And the cheese... don't get me started on the cheese.

I've always LOVED Chipotle, but the experience I had today was beyond horrible! 
I placed an order online for myself and many of my coworkers for lunch. The website is set up perfect so that you can specify exactly what each order should have on it. 
My experienced turned sour when I went to pick up the order. 
Initially I walked in and per my email confirmation advised I walked to the front on the line to pick up my order. 
The cashier ignored me and did not even acknowledge my presence and continued helping others. She did this through 3 customers until I had to say "Excuse me" to get her attention. She then with an attitude got the food and I went on my way. 
When I get back to work, one of the orders was wrong. I called back to Chipotle and was hung up on twice. The third time the woman on the phone began to argue with me saying she did not mess up the order! (where is the customer service?) 
My coworkers along with myself have officially written Chipotle off and will not order from there any longer. 
The worst experience ever... I'm extremely disappointed.

Tried it since the food poisoning scare. Prices up a bit. $1.95 for a little over a tablespoon of guacamole. Their getting stingy on their portions too. Lemonade wasn't as good as what I make at home. Still a burrito is filling but not hot. Just like warm. Won't be returning for awhile. I used to look forward to this location but it's changed.
This location used to be very busy back in the day now you don't have to wait that long to get food. Food is still amazing don't know why people still complain.
Good place to grab a quick bite to eat and have good quality foods at the same time.  This place is always clean and food always taste fresh.  The pulled pork here is the favorite!

I could eat chipotle every single day. They always do a great job on the food. The people are always nice. Even if they are not smiling from ear to ear when it's packed they are still polite and I can tell they're trying their best to handle the rush. I work in retail so I can understand that. They are clean and fast. The only bad thing is that sometimes they are stingy on the portions. I think they are required to only give a certain portion. But that's no problem because you can always ask for extra for no charge except on the meat and guac of course.

Today I ordered a simple steak quesodilla to go and when I got home I was so disappointed to find there was very little to no queso and the steak was crammed in the middle. Next time I will be sure to watch them make my food.

To be honest, it's the same Chipotle food at any other Chipotle, but I give them four stars for being not only on Las Vegas Blvd, but the Premium Outlet shopping center!

They are unexpectedly super fast and friendly. Always.

Chipotle has not let me down ever. The food was amazing like always the food was so juicy and tender it almost mets in your mouth. Not only that but they stuff the plates and you definitely get your moneys worth.

Want to grab a quick lunch and afraid of inconsistency, this place is it.  

We arrived at 12pm for lunch and yes, there was a line, but the line moved super quick.  The ingredients were fresh.

I had the barbacoa burrito, and I could only finish half of this.  It was huge!  The barbacoa meat was tender, but not as flavorful as I would have liked it.  If you are on a low carb diet, you could also get the bowl, which is everything inside of the burrito, minus the tortilla.  The price is reasonable as well.

The employees here are incompetent and screw you over on sizes.

I had a BOGO coupon and went to get 2 bowls.  I asked the woman if I could get two bowls but get the meat & cheese in one and the rice & beans in the other to help accommodate someone who is doing a low carb diet.  She said yes.  Gave a good serving of rice but one small spoonful of beans and I had to ask for more.  For the meats I asked for chicken and barbacoa.  She said "Do you want extra or do you want it half and half?"  I said I just want the normal amount I'd get in each bowl and she looks at me like I'm stupid.  At this point another employee was there and tells her to put in half and half.  Needless to say, I did not get the full amount I would have normally gotten in each bowl, but whatever. The other employee told her half and half.  Then he closes the bowls and I'm off to the cashier.

The cashier rings up a side of rice & beans, a side of barbacoa, and a side of chicken.  No surprise, the coupon doesn't work.  She gets the manager, the manager comes out and I explain to her that I wanted two bowls but all the meat in one and all the rice & beans in another.  She looks at me like I'm stupid.  

How fucking hard is it?  Seriously, charge me for two bowls.  That's all I wanted.  I explained this up front and everyone said it would be fine.  Instead I just left.

Never going to Chipotle again.  Zabas is much closer and better.

I go to chipotle like once a week! This place is crazy busy. It's a Monday at 12:20 in the afternoon. Parking is a challenge for sure! 

There are 5 people behind the counter and 3 people are helping each person at a time! It takes forever to get your order here!! The location is right off the strip and it's in the outlet mall area. 

The location is clean for the most part, but they have NO ONE managing the sitting area that could use a little help.  Glass is clean and floors are clean. 

I would come again... or just head down the street to one that is a bit more organized.

Good price, good food!  I love it! I spend 16$ for me and my daughter, everything taste fresh. Good experience for my first time at the Chipotle, my daughter want to go back tomorrow to have lunch again out there.
The staff here is always nice when I come in. This time I ordered the Queserito and the guy behind the counter gave me a high five lol. Best burrito ever and it's big!

This chipotle restaurant exceeded my expectations. I had never been before, but had heard it was a must. I have both a gluten and a dairy allergy which is usually frustrating when it comes to restaurants. As soon as I informed them of my allergy, all but one staff member stepped back and they changed all of the spoons to avoid cross contamination! Excellent customer service and excellent food! Would recommend to anyone!
I love Chipotle but sometimes they can be stingy when making my burrito bowl. This place is not like that at all. Great amount of food and fresh like always.

Food was okay but trying to get toppings in my order is like pulling teeth. They didn't want to put everything I wanted in the bowl. Since I'm vegan I need substantial amount of food so I can last until dinner from lunch. Also they need more workers to clean the tables. I had to clean a table so I can sit. Little messy for a restaurant.
My coworkers and I order from this Chipotle every Friday.  The food is hot and delicious every time.  Good work guys.  Very nice job taking our large order at rush hour every Friday.

Probably the worst chipotle location I have ever been to. I'm a big fan of chipotle don't get me wrong but this location is awful.

The service is slow, the staff aren't very attentive, and the girl that made my burrito was useless. As soon as I started to open the foil wrap the burrito started falling apart. In the end it's really not that big of a deal but if I wanted a burrito bowl I would have ordered one.

Probably the worst part about this location is the wait time to get your food. The dining area is never all that busy but the line is always at least 15 to 20 mins long. The staff just move slowly plain and simple. 

I will continue to enjoy chipotle, but I don't think I will be returning to this location again, not worth it.

This Chipotle is in the Premium Outlet Shopping Center (near Outback, Chilis, etc.). They offer the typical beer selection along with margaritas (heck yea!). Ordered myself a steak burrito which tastes exactly how Chipotle should taste.

My only complaint is from some woman working behind the counter. One of the guys was putting my order into the register and another guest came up beside me to ask the woman for some chips. The woman, simply standing there beside the man helping me, yells at the guy to bag up some chips. He packaged them while we stood there and, as he went to hand the chips to the guest, she rudely snatched the bag from him and handed them over to the guest herself. Obviously there's some major tension there. Needless to say I was baffled that this behavior was displayed in front of paying customers. If I visit this location again and see similar behavior I'll be sure to speak with a manager.

My wife had been craving this for the last few weeks so I figured okay what the hell, I'll give Chipotle another chance since the departure of the McDonald's influence.  Should have trusted my gut instinct and not had it again.  This place just has horrible food and it is a far cry from authentic Mexican food.  The owner and CEO is a white bald guy who has no clue what ingredients should be in mexican food.  Beans were bland, pork was undercooked and wasn't shredded, and chicken had no taste either.  Just absolutely horrible food, I'd rather have cafeteria food.

I love Chipotle, but this particular location was absurdly slow. I got here at around 2:30pm on a weekday and there were 24 people in line. That's actually not so terrible - I've definitely seen worse at some Chipotle locations - but the problem is, in the first five minutes I waited, they only served a grand total of 4 people. So I left. And so had a couple rather angry-looking customers before I did (making the line only 17 deep when I departed), but that turned out to be of no benefit to me.

Unless you want to chance waiting a long, long, long time for your food (since when is 2:30pm peak hours for a Chipotle....?) - find somewhere else to go. Or place an online order (which would be the only way I would consider giving this location another chance.)

Quite possibly the worst chipotle location ever. The staff is lazy and slow. They consistently have you repeat your order because they can't remember 3 ingredients. They argue with each other and you can tell they don't work well together. The wait is outrageous pretty much any time of day! I've been here 3 times in 2 weeks and I have not waited less than 20 minutes. Even today the line was only 5 people long and it took 20 minutes because they kept running out of stuff. 

I absolutely love chipotle and the food here is no exception in that regard. my bowl was delicious as always but there are dozens of chipotles in the area here so why bother with this awful location? 

They probably don't even read these reviews because they don't care about their guests.

The cash girl was busy flirting with an employee not working. The black guy on grill was busy watching everyone coming through the door instead of preparing for the rush. (they ran out of rice, hot sauce, beans, and chicken while I was here. 15 minute wait for chicken!) 

Look for another chipotle to eat at! It's great food but 0 star service here.
I love everything about chipotle. Nothing new but their philosophy and their customizing is awesome for a vegetarian.
Fresh, clean, polite employees and of course efficient. Can't ask for much more in a restaurant, if the lines are to long they have offered free chips and drinks to shows they notice!

Hah! I'm not the biggest fan of Chipotle, but you do what you got to do when you need to feed.  Recently shopping old Belz (now Premium South Outlets), I realized that meal #4 had to go down and meal #5 was just about 120 minutes later. Here's the dilemma when you're at Belz.  It's hard to find something quick, healthy, and did I mention quick.  One good thing about Chipotle is that they have brown rice, steak, and chicken all ready for you.  For a restaurant in a busy shopping outlet, you would think this Chipotle would be busy. But this Chipotle wasn't.  I entered the premises, requested for two scoops of their chicken/brown rice and I was out with the quickness.  Roughly 10 oz of chicken for less than $10.  Now that's a big on protein and small on the wallet.  Yeah Buddy!!

PS:  I know that Chipotle is known for their burritos, specifically their barbacoa burrito.  Burritos, Schmittos.  I'm sure their good.

YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (402/500)

Chipotle is one of my favorite fast foods and this store is as good as it gets, mainly because the portion sizes are the largest I've ever seen! I stopped by on a Friday night with my parents and it was pretty busy. We shared two chicken bowls, but we really could have just shared one. Everyone else sitting down to eat had bowls piled up high enough that a cover would definitely not fit over it.
Ok I do not do a lot of review and have always liked the food here. That being said got sick as hell after eating here on 4/18/18.

Chipotle is pretty good for the money!! I always get the chicken bowl and it is very tasty. The guacamole and chips are delicious.  I like that it is simple and easy to order.  The chicken can be a little spicy for the kids sometimes.  The food is always fresh here.

I'm a sucker for a FTR. 

This place is yummy and it reminds me of what Taco Del Mar could be if it were any good.

Affordable and fresh.

I've been to this location several times since it's very close to where I work. We also order from this location for in office lunches about once a month.

This location can get really busy since it's in the parking lot of the outlets, but the line moves steadily. I also like that you can order and even pay online to bypass the line to speed things up. The food quality and service quality are up to standard with the chain in general. The only negative for this location to me is the parking lot since it can get pretty crazy. Other than that it's a solid location with the food you'd expect.

As far as Chiplotle's go, this one's on point. The place is clean and the staff has been friendly every time I've been. The quality is generally consistent and they know how to get through a line quickly! This place fills up since it's so close to the outlet mall but because of that you know you're getting fresh food.  A lot of the time the chicken that's on the grill while you're in line is the chicken that goes into your bowl when its your turn to order. Half chicken half barbacoa tacos with guac are my favorite!

My crew boys swear by it, busy busy but fast service, not really my taste in food but it was well prepared and really generous portions.  Heaps of reice with lime, salas, guac, balbacoa and sour cream, in a burrito bowl, tasty.  Other offerings included burritos and salads with chicken beef and balbacoa.  Good fast food for $10.  Outside patio available

First time at this location and it is a busy location but they serve limited alcohol, a plus for any place.

Once we got through the line, the staff are warm and friendly and really go out of their way to make you what you ask for with some extra in it.  The food is good and the place even though busy seems to have a good crowd.

This is a place I would go back to again and just know, expect a crowd being on Las Vegas blvd.

This place is very good to eat at but it drives me crazy that 9 times out of 10 when I order for pick up on my app my food is never ready or even started for that matter and I purposely get there 15-20 minutes after pick up time. I stopped eating at that location for a year so I tried again and still my food isn't ready.  I wish they'd get it together because I'd eat there 2-3 times a week because it's on my way to work.

Pros: It's Chipotle so you know the food is standardized and GOOD. Before dropping off my rental car, I needed to get some gas so this is probably the best restaurant nearby to the airport car rental place. The service was pretty fast and the staff is very friendly with generous helpings in their burritos! The inside is pretty standard and spacious if you have the time or desire to seat down.

Cons: Nothing really wrong with the place but not "as good as it gets" per say.

Overall: Yeah, come get some fast but good food at Chipotle (especially if you want a cheaper meal in Vegas!)

My lunchtime staple, I eat at this location once a week at least.  Service is fast, and this place gets crowded.  Between the nearby employees having lunch or the tourists visiting the outletmalls, it is always busy.

Food is consistent and always good.  I tried online ordering the other day, they had my food ready to go and I walked out in less than 5 minutes.

So this is my second attempt for this location. I love Chipotle but the first time they dropped my food and got the salsa wrong. 

The second time they charged my food and someone else's. Even though I told her what I had. 

It might be because it seems really busy but it just makes me sad. There's another location less than 10 minutes away. I will probably just go there.

Dear everyone,

We go to this Location  almost every Monday. There is a young gentleman named MAURICE. He is so professional and hospitable you"Chipotle" should feel lucky he is on your team. Every trip is a pleasure to me and my wife and three children. Truly MAURICE is great and lifts the spurt of all the team members working with him. The burritos are always spot on due to the Burrito specialist that are awesome as well. 

Thanks 

Pat
It's chipotle and Vegas, so I wasn't expecting 5 star service. Staff was a little off and slightly rude. Food was decent but did serve smaller than usual portions.  A quick walk from Tahiti Village.

Great experience. My wife and I are total social butterflies. And enjoy a good social staff. That's what we got at this chipotle. 

From the moment we walked in, Richard the manager, was communicating with us. While we took forever to decide our meal he kept engaged, he even kept up with the small talk as he was helping out his staff. 

My wife and I continued to be "those customers". After we had him start making burritos, we asked to both switch to salads and he didn't even blink an eye of frustration. So good. 

Then Paloma took care of my wife's very picky choices. And she had a gentle and sweet demeanor. 

Maurice checked out us and was diligent to help me out with information I asked for. 

If customer service was what they sold, they hooked us up! 

Oh yah, the food was really good and they gave us a lot. :) We ended up with steak salads.
Great service at this chipotle! Greeted as soon as I walked in the door by Adam and Christian. Would recommend this chipotle to anyone craving a good meal

Let me start by saying the customer service is not deserving of 2 stars; the employees are always wonderful and pleasant. I'm honestly just SO sick and tired of being excited to get home and eat a burrito bowl that ends up being filled with more fat on chicken than actual chicken. Having to spit a bite into the garbage, sink or a napkin is literally beyond annoying and disappointing. After 10 years of eating chipotle, why am I STILL eating fatty chicken almost every single time I indulge? Also, why am I still eating there? WHY?!
Awesome & fast service. Everything was fresh and also got everything I asked for. Love that everything is organic. Convenient  & clean location.
Kinda slow service and the portions were SO SMALL !!  I was really disappointed barely rice or beans and no guacamole.. paying 15 for nothing it's bs

i'm not really a fan of mexican food , but i love to come to chipotle to get their burritos.
always get the chicken burrito  ( 6.50 $ ) it comes with your choice of toppings.
the food is very tasty and fresh . it's also  VERY  big  !! can never finish one by myself .

Usually good, however they now want to charge you double for a quesaritto?  $12.00 to melt the cheese on a burrito what a rip off and they don't tell you upon ordering only that there is an extra charge!  Chicken salty, going down fast I enjoy cafe rio much better!!

I really enjoy Chipotle...enough for 5 stars. Giving this location 3 Stars bc the service was bad. Not even one employee cracked a half smile when we were in there. I left feeling disappointed, didn't order my usual drink and chips with guac. I was glad to be out of this one...I just don't think the employees like it at this location. :(

If you're looking for a quick casual place to grab a bag go no further than chipotle on Las Vegas Blvd. Are usually get a burrito bowl on occasion I have the quesadilla burrito. The burrito bowl is lay in a refreshing it has fresh salad in there I have a side of guacamole to just send this mail over the top I get the Carnitas me it slow roasted cooked perfectly seasoned tender . All the chips and Kwok or nice and thirsty there's a slight amount of Saul on there as well as some lime in the guac is light and velvety.

Solid 3.5 stars

Favorite locale since it is close to home

5 stars: guacamole - often come in just for the guac to go
4 stars: steak bowl w rice, fajita veggies, lettuce, corn salsa, tomatillo salsa, cheese, sour cream
3 stars: is it my imagination, or are serving sizes shrinking?

Yes it is Americanized Mexican food done McD's style.
Came in November 18 around 7:40 pm. The staff was unfriendly and gave a sense of rudeness. Service was not great

I've sat here for a couple days thinking if I should write this review or not...but I just felt like I couldn't keep this to myself. For one, the food here is not at all fresh. It almost taste expired. Main reason for the low stars is because of the attitudes of the employees. A homeless man came into the restaurant and I totally get that the manager had to tell the man to leave. Totally understandable that customers felt uncomfortable. Problem is that once the man got his water and left the employees chose to stand there and talk shit! Sorry but I didn't know that they were better than this homeless man! Learn some humility! On top of that learn how to be professional in front of other customers! Disgusted with the employees at this location and I won't be back.

My wife was happy to see Carnitas. Had to drive from California for her to get what she wanted. However, the employees helping us did not listen when I asked her for more rice on my plate. She completely ignored me. When I asked for chicken they had none. They seemed to be out of a few things. The cashier was very polite that's why I gave them 3 stars. It's an average place.

There were 3 people ahead of me in line. I waited 15 minutes to order my salad. When it was finally my turn the guy said "just one second". I waited at least ten seconds. He wasn't ready to take my order as he was making burritos for someone not in the building (a phone order perhaps). Since I gave him ten times the time he requested I left. No need to educate ignorant people with how to measure time. Good food, sad service.
This location is always pretty busy.... which is a good thing since that guarantees hot and fresh food!

Like many other Chipotle's this location gets incredibly crowded during lunch. I highly recommend ordering on line. This will allow your food to be ready when you arrive, allowing you to pick it up at the cashier and check out more conveniently. 

This location is well-maintained for how busy they are and systematically and efficiently handle the high-volume. Chipotle now offers brown rice, but I hate to admit I still prefer the white with cilantro. As with other locations, there is a secret menu. I highly recommend the guacamole!
This place is great!! Always great service and food! I come here like 2 a week and every single time the service is exceptional!!! Kudos to the guys and girls behind the counter!!!
